alert.note: Alert for Walker; Waller; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 6:49PM CDT until October 27 at 5:12AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Isolated flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Austin, Grimes, Harris, Montgomery, Walker, Waller and Washington. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen across portions of the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brenham, Hempstead, Prairie View, Bellville, Pinehurst, Waller, Magnolia, New Waverly, Pine Island, Montgomery, Todd Mission, Plantersville and Dobbin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
